availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Rebecca Langley (New Orleans, Louisiana, circus performer,fugitive )

body.p: New Orleans, Louisiana, circus performer. Texas native. Ward of Mr. and Mrs. Carter. Performer for Carter & Wells curiosity show in New Orleans, Louisiana, in 1857. Employed by Elizabeth Benoit and A. Benoit as a performer, known as the "Texas Dwarf" in New Orleans in 1860. Reported as a fugitive from New Orleans, Louisiana, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
"A Big Excuse for a Little Woman," The New Orleans Crescent (New Orleans, La.), Mar. 28, 1860, p. 1.
"Great Living Curiosities," The New Orleans Crescent (New Orleans, La.), Dec. 7, 1857, p. 1.
